page.title: 04Employment, Isle of Skye
page.content: At the turn of the century fishing was the main occupation in the area. It gradually changed towards crofting. Nowadays however very few of the people are involved solely in crofting. A few do still fish. Some are also lobster fishermen. Most people actually travel out of Waternish daily for their main employment. Many families,however,do keep sheep and a few keep cows and goats. Very few families are self-sufficient in milk. Most of the milk consumed here is brought in from either Inverness or Dingwall. The people who have sheep and cattle attend to them after work and at week-ends.The Forestry Commission also give employment to a few. The Commision moved in about twenty years ago.
